title: ICE with Unicode character following `if` in `if` conditional without condition

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Inspired by #68000. Nobody will write code like this ever, but it's still an ICE. This regression was introduced in Rust 1.25, this worked in Rust 1.24.

```rust
macro_rules! x {
    ($($c:tt)*) => {
        $($c)ö* {}
    };
}

fn main() {
    x!(if);
}
```
